posts.post_content:
With at least 10 different Illusion creatures in Jace's deck (this fellow included), it shouldn't be uncommon to see the Mist swinging in for 4 or 5 damage at a time, often alongside a [Phantasmal Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phantasmal Dragon) or [Jace's Phantasm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace's Phantasm), both of which have the potential to be 5/5 beaters as well.  
  
It's interesting to see Blue being so aggressive, especially with the other Duel Deck being part Green. Big creatures are particularly exciting for newer players, so I've got a feeling that these decks will go over really well with casual players like myself.  
  
Honestly, I'm pumped to plunk down the $25 or $30 to enjoy an afternoon battling back and forth with a friend. The best part is, these decks are perfect for teaching new players how to play the game, and both decks just *beg* to be tweaked and upgraded, so the fun lasts a whole lot longer than the original decks ever will.

posts.post_content: Ah hell, not this guy. This card was the reason Jace's deck in DotP 2012 was overpowered as hell, and while it's not as bad in the context of these Duel Decks, I still hate it. I'm just happy they decided to not reprint [Lord of the Unreal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lord of the Unreal) for this, or he'd be *too* good.
